alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake Valley (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 29 at 2:50AM MST until November 29 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches with locally higher amounts possible. * WHERE...Salt Lake Valley. * WHEN...Until 2 PM MST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute across portions of Salt Lake County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A lake effect snow band is expected to develop early this morning and continue through around 11 AM. Periods of moderate to heavy snow will bring additional snow accumulations to locations impacted by this band, currently most likely to impact portions of southern and eastern Salt Lake County.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
